The oldest and most widely used drug in the world, alcohol is also the drug most frequently used by teens.

Alcohol is a liquid that people drink. Adolescents who want to get drunk will often drink 'shots,' which are small glasses of straight liquor, because the body absorbs the alcohol much faster that way.
Signs of teenage drinking include the smell of alcohol on your child's breath, slurred speech, lack of coordination, nausea, vomiting, and hangovers.
